name: Aisha Khan
title: Mechanical Engineer Intern → R&D Engineer
summary: From school robotics club to a paid internship building test rigs for EV motors.
story: Aisha led her school robotics team, then cold-emailed a local EV startup with a one-page portfolio. She landed an 8-week internship and shipped a fixture that cut testing time by 40%.

name: Daniel Okoye
title: Civil Engineering Student → Site Engineer (Part-time)
summary: Turned a classroom drainage project into a part-time role with a city contractor.
story: Daniel mapped flood-prone streets near campus and proposed low-cost French drains. A municipal contractor hired him part-time to assist with site surveys and CAD markups.

name: Marta Silva
title: Process Engineer
summary: Cut defect rate 18% by piloting SPC with Python dashboards.
story: As a new hire, Marta automated data pulls from PLC logs and visualized SPC limits in a small web app, helping shift leads respond to out-of-control points instantly.

name: Kenji Watanabe
title: Senior Reliability Engineer
summary: Moved from QA to reliability; introduced HALT that reduced RMAs by 27%.
story: Kenji championed Highly Accelerated Life Testing (HALT), built fixtures, and coached teams on failure mode tracking. Warranty returns fell notably within two quarters.

name: Priya Natarajan
title: High-School App Club → Entry iOS Developer
summary: Built a study-planner app; hit 5k downloads and landed a summer dev role.
story: Priya shipped a SwiftUI study planner, open-sourced bits of it, and wrote a clear README. A local ed-tech noticed and invited her to a paid summer placement.

name: Ahmed El-Sherif
title: Cybersecurity Analyst (SOC)
summary: Pivoted from helpdesk to SOC by completing blue-team labs and a homelab SIEM.
story: Ahmed set up a homelab with Wazuh, wrote playbooks for common alerts, and showcased METRICS in interviews—earning a SOC analyst role.

name: Lina Park
title: Data Engineer → Analytics Lead
summary: Unified marketing data; created dbt models and KPI trust across teams.
story: Lina rebuilt pipelines with dbt and BigQuery, added CI tests for freshness, and launched a metrics catalog, reducing report disputes by 70%.

name: Marco Rossi
title: Game Dev Student → Unity Freelancer
summary: Turned game jam prototypes into paid client work.
story: Marco joined monthly jams, posted playable builds, and documented code. An indie studio hired him to optimize shaders for mobile.

name: Grace Mensah
title: Nursing Student → Community Health Fellow
summary: Led a campus vaccination drive that reached 1,200 residents.
story: Grace coordinated volunteers, partnered with clinics, and created multilingual flyers—skills she leveraged into a competitive fellowship.

name: Dr. Mateo Alvarez
title: Resident → Clinical Researcher
summary: Published a small RCT on post-op pain protocols.
story: Mateo designed surveys, coordinated IRB, and co-authored a paper that informed his hospital’s revised ERAS pathway.

name: Hannah Cole
title: Physiotherapist → Clinic Owner
summary: Opened a community-first clinic with outcome tracking.
story: Hannah piloted PROMs collection via QR codes and used the data to refine programs and win local grants.

name: Yusuf Al-Hassan
title: Pharmacy Student → Hospital Intern
summary: Built a medication-error poster that became an internal training module.
story: Yusuf analyzed incident logs and proposed a labeling tweak; the unit adopted his recommendation across three wards.

name: Zara Qureshi
title: Campus Finance Society → Equity Research Intern
summary: Built a simple DCF on FMCG stocks that impressed recruiters.
story: Zara wrote neat one-pagers, kept a valuation diary, and networked via alumni coffees—earning a front-office internship.

name: Luis Fernandez
title: Operations Analyst
summary: Saved 180 labor hours/month by automating order exceptions.
story: Luis built a lightweight rules engine in Google Apps Script to flag order anomalies and email owners, clearing backlogs weekly.

name: Mei Lin
title: Product Manager
summary: Shipped a pricing experiment that lifted ARPU 9%.
story: Mei coordinated pricing research, ran a 4-cell test, and aligned GTM—documenting learnings in a crisp PRD.

name: Omar Farouk
title: Marketing Student → SEO Associate
summary: Scaled a personal blog to 30k monthly visits and converted it into a role.
story: Omar published weekly, learned technical SEO, and presented a content calendar that impressed a SaaS founder.

name: Nadia Petrova
title: Illustration Student → Book Cover Artist
summary: Won a small press cover contest; now commissioned for a trilogy.
story: Nadia posted process reels on IG and Behance, built a mood board with authors, and nailed timelines.

name: Arjun Mehta
title: UX Designer
summary: Redesigned onboarding; cut time-to-value by 32%.
story: Arjun ran 12 usability tests, iterated wireframes, and aligned dev with a living Figma spec.

name: Sofia Romano
title: Creative Director
summary: Led a rebrand for a nonprofit; donations rose 14% YoY.
story: Sofia set a brand voice guide, refreshed typography, and trained volunteers on asset use.

name: Leo Martins
title: Photography Student → Festival Photographer
summary: Got media credentials after emailing a tight portfolio to organizers.
story: Leo curated 20 best shots, included alt text and EXIF captions, and delivered edits within 24 hours.

name: Helena Fischer
title: Biology Student → Lab Assistant
summary: Learned pipetting via online modules; joined a genetics lab.
story: Helena completed virtual labs, passed safety training, and maintained lab notebooks meticulously—earning authorship on a poster.

name: Rafael Costa
title: Environmental Scientist
summary: Modeled air quality with open data; city used it for a pilot.
story: Rafael merged satellite and station datasets, published a reproducible workflow, and consulted on policy drafts.

name: Dr. Evelyn Carter
title: Senior Chemist → R&D Manager
summary: Scaled an eco-friendly coating from bench to pilot line.
story: Evelyn built a cross-functional schedule, quality gates, and transfer docs; first customer shipments hit spec on time.

name: Minh Nguyen
title: Physics Student → Science Communicator
summary: Grew a short-form physics channel to 80k followers.
story: Minh wrote scripts with simple analogies, added captions, and kept a weekly release cadence, leading to paid collaborations.
